fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Competition, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Climate Action
inter_groups: 1. Urban, 2. Climate change, sustainable development and biodiversity.
eu_initiatives: LH follows the activities of the EU institutions principally relating to climate change energy, circular economy and environment (incl. waste, biodiversity and industrial emissions). Specific initiatives followed include: com (2013) 919, com (2014) 397, com (2014) 398, com (2014) 445, com (2014) 020, com (2015) 337, 2015/0275, 2016/0376, 2016/0381, 2018/0178 (COD)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: The main organisations that LafargeHolcim adheres to include: Cembureau, EUPG, ERMCO, Eucopro, Globe EU, IETA, ERT, ECRA, AECA.
relevant_communication: LafargeHolcim participates actively to the activities of trade federations and other organisations it adheres to. As an active member of Cembureau, we participate to the "Concrete Initiative" which aims to put forward the role of concrete in sustainable construction.
goals__remit: Founded in 2015 by the merger of Lafarge and Holcim, LafargeHolcim is the world's most advanced group in the building material industry. We provide innovative cement, aggregates ready-mix concrete and asphalt products, as well as associated services and solutions. LafargeHolcim is a global company employing 81000 employees across 80 countries.
